labels.name: wontfix

issues.title: ICMPv6 error proxy
issues.author: otroan
issues.body:
To pass an ICMPv6 error message, the NPTv6 node needs to also translate the embedded IPv6 packet.
This would be an IPv6 variant of section 4 RFC5508.
I haven't found other documents describing IPv6 NAT ICMP error handling.

issues.title: Review section 5.3 on future work
issues.author: otroan
issues.body:
Consider if a mechanism to get the outside address can be specified?
Some sort of integration with STUN?

issues.title: Recommendations regarding source address selection
issues.author: otroan
issues.body:
The typical use case for NTPv6 would be an internal network using ULA addressing.
Should we ensure that SAS / Happy eyeballs give ULA -> GUA connections a decent chance? Consider them equivalent to IPv4 RFC1918 to global?
Don't know if this is text in this document, or if we should try to affect the SAS bis document?

comments.author: buraglio
comments.body: I just sent mail requesting WGLC for the 6724 update that sets preference for IPv4 below all IPv6, including ULA. I think that would cover the SAS in question here. There is significant appetite for fixing that based on the list discussion and the IETF 117 presentation.

issues.title: Obsoletes not Updates
issues.author: becarpenter
issues.body: This is a replacement for RFC 6296 so it should be Obsoletes: 6296

issues.title: Addressing text and ALG considerations section
issues.author: otroan
issues.body:
Remove "at the mercy of" and "misuse".

I imagine that pushback will continue. In order to make the discussion rational rather than emotional, I think the "NPTv6 Applicability" section needs major work. There are generalisations like "similar ALGs may be required for these applications to work through NPTv6 Translators" and "creates complexity for DNS deployment... 'split DNS', which may add complexity to network configuration". I think that text needs to specify the necessary mitigations and give normative references.

Similarly the paragraph about ULAs is very tentative and needs to be much clearer. And its final sentence:

"Also, using any other global-scope address format makes one either obtain a PI prefix or be at the mercy of the agency from which it was allocated."

seems wrong. Candidates to use NPTv6 seem unlikely to pay for a PI prefix, because they can multihome anyway. And you might get away with "at the mercy of" in an Experimental RFC, but surely not on the standards track.

issues.title: Outdated Text
issues.author: boucadair
issues.body:
https://github.com/buraglio/rfc6296-bis/blob/3609a71baf805fbdbe51855d0dd84a51f3198425/draft-bctb-6man-rfc6296-bis.md?plain=1#L823C1-L832C51

We do have a mechanism to fill that void since then: RFC6887. 

I suggest to update that section accordingly.

issues.title: Update abstract
issues.author: otroan
issues.body:
(1) Update the abstract to indicate that this document obsoletes RFC 6296.

Reported by: Med.

issues.title: Section for list of changes since 6296
issues.author: otroan
issues.body:
(2) Consider adding a subsection or an appendix with a list of changes vs. 6296 as per this Guidelines "Ensure the I-D clearly summarizes any changes made from the RFCs being updated or obsoleted.". I would list in particular there that erratum https://www.rfc-editor.org/errata/eid3033 was implemented.

Reported by: Med

issues.title: Make IPv6 address examples consistent with RFC5952
issues.author: otroan
issues.body:
(3) Update all IPv6 address examples to be consistent with RFC 5952.

Reported by Med

issues.title: ALG text
issues.author: otroan
issues.body:
(4) Section 7:

4.1. Please note that the "NPTv6 Applicability" section says the following:

  These applications currently require
  Application Layer Gateways (ALGs) to work correctly through NAPT44
  devices, and similar ALGs may be required for these applications to
  work through NPTv6 Translators.

  Which may seem to be conflicting with the reco in Section 7. Please reword to avoid internal inconsistency.

4.2. An approach to avoid ALGs is to discover the external prefix used by the NPTv6. A discovery approach is specified in https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc6887#section-2.1.

Reported by Med

issues.title: RFC7942 note
issues.author: otroan
issues.body:
(5) Section 8: Add a note as per RFC 7942

  Since this information is necessarily time dependent, it is
  inappropriate for inclusion in a published RFC.  The authors should
  include a note to the RFC Editor requesting that the section be
  removed before publication.


Reported by Med

issues.title: Manageability text
issues.author: otroan
issues.body:
(6) Consider adding some text about the manageability of NPTv6. FWIW, you may refer for the provisioning of NPTv6 (https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc8512#autoid-33)

Reported by Med

issues.title: Update RFC references
issues.author: otroan
issues.body:
(7) Update many RFCs as they were obsoleted since then (e.g., RFC 5996, RFC 6204, RFC 5389, RFC 5766, RFC 5245, ..)

Reported by Med

issues.title: IKEv2/IPsec NAT traversal
issues.author: boucadair
issues.body:
This text in the original RFC is OK as the intent was to conduct experiments. I'm afraid that is not appropriate to leave it as such in the bis:

>  
>   Due to the potential interactions with IKEv2/IPsec NAT traversal, it
>    would be valuable to test interactions of NPTv6 with various aspects
>    of current-day IKEv2/IPsec NAT traversal.

pulls.title: Leading zeros MUST be suppressed as per RFC5952
pulls.author: boucadair

comments.body: You probably don't want to make these leading zero changes to the RFC references. :-)

```suggestion
deployment of NPTv6 to read {{RFC4864}} and {{RFC5902}}, and to carefully
```

ha ha ha. 

I don't know how this was changed, but I updated the PR.

pulls.title: compile Verification Code on macOS.
pulls.author: tsahara
pulls.body:
Verification Code in appendix B does not compile on the latest version of macOS / Xcode due to an undeclared function erorr.  We should include <stdlib.h> to call atoi(3).

```
% cc --version
Apple clang version 15.0.0 (clang-1500.1.0.2.5)
Target: x86_64-apple-darwin23.3.0
Thread model: posix
InstalledDir: /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin

% cc nptv6.c
nptv6.c:68:1: warning: a function definition without a prototype is deprecated in all versions of C and is not supported in C2x [-Wdeprecated-non-prototype]
add1(number1, number2)
^
nptv6.c:93:1: warning: a function definition without a prototype is deprecated in all versions of C and is not supported in C2x [-Wdeprecated-non-prototype]
sub1(number1, number2)
^
nptv6.c:104:1: warning: a function definition without a prototype is deprecated in all versions of C and is not supported in C2x [-Wdeprecated-non-prototype]
sum1(numbers, count)
^
nptv6.c:135:1: warning: a function definition without a prototype is deprecated in all versions of C and is not supported in C2x [-Wdeprecated-non-prototype]
nptv6_initialization(subnet)
^
nptv6.c:205:1: warning: type specifier missing, defaults to 'int'; ISO C99 and later do not support implicit int [-Wimplicit-int]
main(argc, argv)
^
int
nptv6.c:216:19: error: call to undeclared function 'atoi'; ISO C99 and later do not support implicit function declarations [-Wimplicit-function-declaration]
       suppress = atoi(argv[1]);
                  ^
nptv6.c:205:1: warning: a function definition without a prototype is deprecated in all versions of C and is not supported in C2x [-Wdeprecated-non-prototype]
main(argc, argv)
^
6 warnings and 1 error generated.
```

fixed:

```
% cc nptv6.c
nptv6.c:69:1: warning: a function definition without a prototype is deprecated in all versions of C and is not supported in C2x [-Wdeprecated-non-prototype]
add1(number1, number2)
^
nptv6.c:94:1: warning: a function definition without a prototype is deprecated in all versions of C and is not supported in C2x [-Wdeprecated-non-prototype]
sub1(number1, number2)
^
nptv6.c:105:1: warning: a function definition without a prototype is deprecated in all versions of C and is not supported in C2x [-Wdeprecated-non-prototype]
sum1(numbers, count)
^
nptv6.c:136:1: warning: a function definition without a prototype is deprecated in all versions of C and is not supported in C2x [-Wdeprecated-non-prototype]
nptv6_initialization(subnet)
^
nptv6.c:206:1: warning: type specifier missing, defaults to 'int'; ISO C99 and later do not support implicit int [-Wimplicit-int]
main(argc, argv)
^
int
nptv6.c:206:1: warning: a function definition without a prototype is deprecated in all versions of C and is not supported in C2x [-Wdeprecated-non-prototype]
6 warnings generated.

% ./a.out 1
outer->inner different: calculated: fd01:203:405:0:2:3:4:5 inner: fd01:203:405:ffff:2:3:4:5
% ./a.out 0
outer->inner different: calculated: fd01:203:405:ffff:2:3:4:5 inner: fd01:203:405:0:2:3:4:5
```
